Reviews.Title: “Simply the best! We live in Seattle and reccomend this place for folks we love.”
Reviews.Author: Enzo2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Deca is where we trust family and friends when they visit Seattle. From check in to check out this is an art deco hotel with class and the best location to enjoy our hometown favorites....

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Deca was an absolute pleasure from beginning to end! Every staff member I encountered was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Check in was speedy and efficient and we were greeted very warmly. Room service was delicious and very fairly priced and all our needs were met with staff members going above and beyond in all areas. At one point we called downstairs to ask for forks for a late night meal we had brought in with us - just moments later a hotel employee showed up with our forks and, anticipating what other needs we might have, had brought warmed plates in case we needed them. We had not even thought to ask and, as it turned out, we did need them! The room itself was neat, clean, very new looking, with elegant furnishings and the beds were soooo comfortable! Tons of pillows and plush bedding. The halls were nice and quiet. The hotel is in a great spot and the on-site parking is very convenient. All in all I LOVED this hotel and will be staying there whenever I am in Seattle from now on. I just can't say enough positive things about my stay. THANK YOU, Hotel Deca, for a very memorable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in the university district”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here in March whilst in Seattle on business at Washington University. The staff are friendly and helpful. The reception areas are comfortable and nicely designed. My room was spacious and comfortable. The location is good for the university district and the hotel has a shuttle bus into the City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jaeded07
Reviews.Content: If you have a reason to be at the University of Washington, there probably isn't a more convenient hotel. The pictures you see online are very representational of the decor, though the bathrooms are a little dated. As with most hotels in Seattle in this price range, the rooms aren't spacious, but they were very well appointed. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the air unit not overly loud. Our room's door didn't fit very well so a very large line of light leaked in from the hallway all night. If I'd been traveling solo I would have been a little freaked out about it. I agree with another reviewer that they should have at least a small mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great restaurant, very close to UW campus”
Reviews.Author: profn
Reviews.Content: On the map, Deca looks farther from campus than it is. It's practically across the street. The hotel is charming, not cookie cutter, The District restaurant has amazing breakfasts and is a fun pub at night. It's reasonably priced. Parking is very convenient-- the breakfast/parking package is a great deal. Staff is friendly. Room was spotless. There is some traffic noise, but that's what you get in return for the great location. My bed was very comfortable. Free wi-fi a plus! I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Feels like a more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca was recommended to me because it is close to the UW and my husband and I were taking my son on a college tour. Hotel Deca is really convenient for touring the UW -- tours begin at Schmizt Hall which is literally a few blocks from the hotel. Instead of searching for parking at the campus, the front desk allowed us leave our car in the Hotel Deca parking lot even though we had checked out of the hotel. I opted to upgrade our room to the city view, 2 queen room since we were going to be in Seattle a few days and I wanted a larger space to hang out with our teenage son. The room was very spacious and included a sofa and sitting area with a desk. At the time of our booking, there were specials on the website which basically included free parking and one free breakfast for the regular price of our room. I thought it was such a good deal! I gave my husband, who likes a big breakfast and gets up early, the breakfast voucher and my son and I bought some groceries at Trader Joes which was close by. The room had a nice size refrigerator and microwave oven which was an added convenience. While I was checking out of the hotel, I struck up a conversation with one of the front desk clerks named Jimmy. He was very personable and he gave me directions, lunch recommendations and a lot of information about UW. He was very excited that my son is interested in attending UW, especially since he would be coming from Los Angeles. Jimmy stored our luggage while we toured UW and when we returned to the hotel to pick up our luggage, Jimmy had a gift for me and my husband. He had gone to the UW bookstore and purchased two mugs, "UW Mom" and "UW Dad!" That was the most thoughtful thing any hotel staff member has ever done for me!!! I really hope that my son goes to UW so that I can return frequently to the lovely Hotel Deca with the nice, welcoming staff. Thank you, Jimmy, for your sweet gesture!

Reviews.Title: “Class Act All The Way”
Reviews.Author: CreativeSpark
Reviews.Content: If you've seen the photos of this hotel, it's exactly that. Nice restoration, helpful staff, a big (fake) fire to keep you warm in the Seattle chill and lots of comfy grouped furniture for chatting in the lobby, fast and free wifi throughout. Our room was big, with a chaise lounge in the bay window, a bathtub, a designer desk/chair, king sized bed and lots of TV channels. The windows opened, which I always think is nice, and tea and pods for the coffee maker got replaced every day. The only thing we were missing was a fridge. The great thing about staying here is that it's a block from University Ave, where you'll find lots of indi cafes, restaurants ranging from vegan pizza to spicy ramen and an eclectic mix of stores (vintage clothing, books, sports etc) catering to the university population. Lots of cheap eats and great coffee. It's also a short walk to an arthouse cinema, a mainstream cinema and a massive art supply shop. We also made good use of the cab rank, right outside, and the Tulley's Coffee and District Bar, right inside. The upgrading looks to be ongoing... the hallways outside the rooms have seen better days... but otherwise this is a great hotel in a great location in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Form over Function”
Reviews.Author: DocHoliday62
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here because we were attending an event at the University of Washington. Our first choice, the Silver Cloud Inn-University District, was fully booked. The place is nicely decorated, and the beds are comfortable. However, amenities like a fridge and a coffee maker (standard even in budget hotels) are lacking here. During our stay, this facility demonstrated a number of peculiar (and irritating) inconsistencies. An iron and ironing board were provided, for instance, in a large closet, but it had no light. So it was necessary to grope to find it or to hang or retrieve clothes. Further, that was the ONLY place to store clothing because there were no dressers. Although they offer WiFi, and it was easy to access, there was only one chair at a glass table filling in for a desk. Unfortunately, a mouse doesn't function on such surfaces. The bathroom had lovely deco fixtures and hardware, but the stopper in the basin didn't work. A narrow, sloping shelf with a gap behind it couldn't accommodate toiletries for two (or one, for that matter, because they kept slipping off). Re: the rest of the hotel: the restaurant had a very limited menu with nothing we could eat (we're vegan). Consequently, we had to trek several blocks to find breakfast. And, while there are plenty of good restaurants in the area, it's nice not to have to search for one first thing in morning. (Again, a small refrigerator and microwave would have allowed us to eat in the room.) Style definitely trumps substance at the Deca. Important practical considerations have been ignored, and maintenance could also be improved. I like a pretty place as much as the next person, but not at the expense of functionality and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely restored old hotel, but with very, very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Eyedoc54
Reviews.Content: It's great that various corporations are buying these old urban hotels and rehabbing them. Hotel Deca is decorated a lot more nicely than it was when I stayed there 20 years ago when it was named University Tower. The staff is to be commended for excellence. I wish all hotels had staff that good. The downside is that the rooms and the bathrooms are very small. We had a King with city view, which means the parking lot, mostly. The sound insulation between the rooms and the hallways is very poor. I would not suggest this for a family unless you prefer multiple rooms. Likewise, the rooms are a tight fit for a couple. I think people must have been a lot smaller and they did not carry so much stuff with them when this hotel was built.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon D
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely accommodating. We were allowed to check-in early and our request to stay on an upper floor was honored. Our junior suite was large, comfortable, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Exquisiticity
Reviews.Content: My mom and I flew to Seattle for a weekend so that I could interview at UW. Our flight put us in the Seattle area around 1pm. We were allowed to check in early and we really had a great first impression of the staff. They were very friendly and explained all of the services available at the hotel, as well as provided a map of the UW campus which helped me SO much for my interview day. They were also very helpful in providing us suggestions for going out to places to eat and shop around town. It was very clean; I felt so good being there. Even the cleaning staff were friendly. The beds were very comfortable and clean - what a great night's sleep! I also appreciated the detail of the complementary earplugs they provided – too bad I didn’t need them. The bathroom was elegant. The tv was very cool. They provided a wine opener, hair dryer, and iron/ironing board. I'm so glad we had access to wi-fi in the room. The walk-in closet was a pleasant surprise. The view was FABULOUS! The staff was SO accommodating! I have never, ever had such a pleasant experience with hotel staff anywhere! Most special was the surprise gift basket that Tanya sent up to the room with a card wishing me luck on my interview at UW the following day, a box of chamomile tea (my favorite!!), a print out of interview tips, and some chocolate candies. They provide a complementary shuttle service anywhere within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. That service was excellent - very timely, clean, and with safe drivers. It was a pleasant surprise to have this service available, especially since it transported me to my interview in the rain - I don't know what I would've done if I had to walk! Also, I really enjoyed the fitness facility (the treadmill and tv were great; very clean; great to have water, towels, and clorox wipes) and wished I could've taken advantage of the passes to go to the outside gym, too...Next time! ;) I had an interview at UW until about 3:30pm and our flight wasn't until 10pm on the night of the day we checked out. Staff was so accommodating - they let us have a late check out, store our bags, access our bags when we accidentally forgot to unpack/pack something, and hang out in the lobby and have a light dinner while we waited for our (non-hotel) airport shuttle. I was, again, very pleasantly surprised that the hotel shuttle service was willing to bring me back from my interview to the hotel, even after we had technically checked out of our room.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juel E
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many places. I have seen some of the best hotels and I have encountered some great services.From Hyatt to The Breakers Hotel, I am always amazed at the service I get when staying these providers, but Hotel DECA have raised the bar. The Hotel is very well maintained, its clean, comfortable, has great views of the city and Lake Washington... its a must stay if you are in the Seattle Area. Its worth foregoing a stay downtown and coming just a few miles north to this hidden treasure (just north of the Universirty of Washington Campus)... I would like to personally thank JIMMY, PAUL, EMILY and KADIJAH for representing the Hotel very well! They are awesome and are very customer oriented and really know how to make you feel like you are the ONLY person in the hotel. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU! Simply AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: I received early check in, free mimosa makings, wonderful view and nothing but great customer service all the way around. Ryan went above and beyond to ensure a great visit for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RoosterJones
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in the University district, with plenty of bars & restaurants nearby. The staff were very helpful, we had to drop our rental car downtown, so they arranged for us to be picked up and bought back to the hotel. The staff were also able to offer their reccommendations for places to drink too. The room was very comfortable & well equipped. A perfect end to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Noise Issues”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca is an excellent hotel that is in the middle of everything. The staff are very helpful. The Hotel Deca's rooms are comfortable and clean. The building was originally built in 1931, but it has been renovated since then. Everything is great about this hotel, except the workout room, which is a little bit small. They do make up for this by offering free passes to the gym down the street. The only reason I rated this hotel four stars is because one of the nights there was a party downstairs. (We are only on the second floor.) and even after the quiet time (10 PM) the music continued. I called the front desk and the person down there told me that it was going to be over at 11. I think the noise levels are normally fine, but whenever there is a party downstairs it can get really loud. (The only reason I rated the kids activities as an average, is because there are not any that the hotel provides.)

Reviews.Title: “A charming urban and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: classyandchic
Reviews.Content: This is a charming boutique hotel located near the University of Washington. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and the beds were very comfy. We would definitely stay here again during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the U District”
Reviews.Author: lobosfan24
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was excellent! We were going with some friends to see Roger Clyne at the Neptune, which is right across the street from the hotel. My friend didn't book a room, but Emily was able to book us another room at the last minute. She even gave us a complimentary upgrade so our two rooms could be next to each other. The staff was friendly, plenty of parking spaces, and the location couldn't have been better. We will definitely being going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Cielamae
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and reasonably priced hotel. Very relaxing! Nice rooms, clean and we had a beautiful view of Lake Washington! We had the perfect sunrise view! The staff were friendly and courteous and very helpful! Thank you. I recommend this hotel! Cheryl S

Reviews.Title: “Great Property at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Hotel Deca. Perfect location for my business needs. The staff is first-rate and actually care about your stay. The room is super clean (a must) with many nice little touches...like great black-out drapes that help to get a good nights sleep. The hotel is nice and quiet and the lobby with the fireplace is very warm and comfortable. I highly recommend and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Each visit a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Papa98765
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times visiting new granddaughter in Seattle. Always extremely friendly and helpful staff, offered us upgrade for free after our first two nights in sold out hotel (we declined because our king sized bed room was just fine) Checkin and out always fast. Free parking a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Art Deco hotel with Tully's coffee shop on-site”
Reviews.Author: travelsketchwrite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time recently after flying into SeaTac airport. Arriving late at night we were quickly checked in and appreciated the free parking. Our room was very attractive, quiet and spacious. Our king size bed was quite comfortable. In the morning we enjoyed going down to Tully's for a good cup of coffee and muffin. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location for UW visit”
Reviews.Author: JPWPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca is a very nicely appointed hotel in a great location (2 blocks from UW campus). The hotel staff was extremely courteous. The hotel is a bit artsy. The rooms are a good size, clean and plenty of hot water. Coffee shop in the lobby, tables and comfy chairs to sit in while using the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 12”
Reviews.Author: dt2018
Reviews.Content: Great service - the hotel shuttle to downtown rocks

Reviews.Title: “Great Art Deco Hotel in the heart of the University District”
Reviews.Author: galvin42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice for single night stays. Love the decor of the hotel. The rooms are nice and have always accommodated our needs. We have also been about to get a reasonable last minute rate. Nice place for an Eastsider to stay when having a nice evening in Greenlake/Phinney Ridge/Ballard area. Have not eaten at the on-site restaurant, but the menu looked good and reasonably priced. WIll continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great place great views”
Reviews.Author: kulicky
Reviews.Content: beautiful room with a view. all staff was friendly and helpful. very modern decor, and clean. would definitely stay again next time i'm in town. location was great, right next to the university and plenty of restaurants nearby. there's a key bank right next door to the hotel. two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tyler T
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca is an amazing place to stay, especially if you are a fan of any sort of architecture. However, the customer service takes precedence over anything else at this establishment.Front desk agents like Emily are what make this an extraordinary lodging experience; amenities and scenic views of Seattle aside! One MUST stay at the Hotel Deca!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! Great quality for the price. Great views. Friendly staff, and also friendly people staying at the hotel. We were easily able to park a large vehicle we use for work on site. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bygone era feeling”
Reviews.Author: AmyGrammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights, visiting our son. Great location, easy to navigate. Wonderful bed. Loved our 5th floor view. Nice size desk with comfortable chair, lighting, and wifi, making it very easy to do some work away from home. We loved the decor and the sense of high-style travel from times gone by, yet completely modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor but thin wall”
Reviews.Author: Miu2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night back in September. The location is close to university but feel little not safe walking around as there were some hobo around . Our room was in higher floor but the street noise was still loud. We heard few sirens during night and the room also provide ear plug so u can imagin. The room is nice but little tired looking and the bathroom is tiny. The staffs are friendly and they also loan out movie DVD free for us to enjoy it. If u like the art work this is the one. I may not go back if we have to pay that price unless is on sale.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaton and Value.”
Reviews.Author: mld160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Deca for a combination business/pleasure trip. We visited with our son who is attending the UW. We had business meetings in downtown Seattle. We found the location to extremely convenient with easy access to both campus and to downtown. The hotel is older but has been remodeled and everything was in good working order. The staff was excellent. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Snowed in and Loved Every Minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: karra j
Reviews.Content: I am an RN at the Univeristy of Washington Medical Center. I live up north in Lynnwood but due to the snow storm and my requirement to be at work (as our patients come first and the hospital never closes) I needed a place within walking distance to my job. Hotel Deca was perfect for my price range and I found out during my three day stay that they offer discounts to UW Employees (so I was offered a refund)...bonus!! The staff was amazing, the food was to die for, and they even have happy hour :) I would most definitely stay here again...even for a mini 'stay-cation.' Thank you for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mystic2608
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate what the other good reviews say. Excellent friendly service. Older hotel with a new face, great decor choice. Clean. Great view. Close to shops. Quick taxi to our destinations. Parking charge but reasonable. Free WiFi was handy. Restaurant downstairs for breakfast was fine. We went at Christmas and the price was reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Deca”
Reviews.Author: ceedub76
Reviews.Content: Super friendly staff, very helpful and genuine. The hotel felt safe, and secure. (I've stayed in some that dont give you that vibe!) Awesome renos and keeping with the retro feel. Convenient access to the I-5 which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CMF_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Deca a couple months ago with my husband for our anniversary. We had the best time and loved our room. My husband and I were both very pleased with how friendly your staff was, especially the handsome front desk agent, Alex. He was extremely friendly and went out of his way to make us feel special for our anniversary. Having staff like yours is guaranteed to keep us coming back! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Espo109
Reviews.Content: A few minutes from downtown Seattle. Awesome environment and right in the heart of U District. Very comfortable and convenient. Free parking and free wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Want2travel8082
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation by phone, the agent assisted me in getting the best price & room and was very helpful. This is an older hotel which gave it an old/new feel. The hotel was very clean and the view on the 14th floor was phenominal with a memorable sunrise, view of mountains, Lake Washington and Mt. Rainer sitting majestically to the southeast. The bed was comfortable with a good pillow - not too fluffy. My only problem was no wi-fi access which is a big deal to me. I went down to the front desk for assistance, the clerk wasn't able to resolve the problem. He was assisting another guest who also couldn't connect to wi-fi and could only provide a phone number for guests to call the internet provider for assistance. The other guest stated that she tried but just got voice mail, she too was frustrated that the hotel was unable to resolve the problem. Nice hotel but come'on, guests shouldn't have to call the internet provider for assistance, that is the hotel's job! Maybe a rating of 4 is too high for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated New Year's in Style”
Reviews.Author: Stormy989
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome staff, wonderful view of the Space Needle fireworks on New Year's eve. Lobby is warm and inviting. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Walking distance to dining, shopping, the university and Burke Museum. When in Seattle, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel online for New Years Eve. We arrived to find out that we paid for the most expensive room which we thought we would have a view, not so much, we were on the second floor looking out onto the gravel roof. We noticed there was some sort of dried fluid on the couch cushion. You don't get any local network channels on the TV, you have to pay for them. Our shower facet dripped all night long and when we got up this morning to take a shower the shower faucet wouldnt turn on so we did not even get a shower. The parking was to be free and they charge $12 to park in their lot which they dont tell you til you check out. They also charge $30 for incidentals which they dont tell you until you check in. The restaurant and bar/lounge was ironically closed that week as well. We got home and took showers and my husband noticed he had a couple bites on his body which after looking up online resemble bed bug bites.............This hotel was the biggest disappointment and mistake of our stay in Seattle, We will NEVER stay here again!!!! The front desk clerk told us he would give us our money back....lets hope they follow through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lis G
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend and had a wonderful experience. All of the staff were friendly and very helpful. The shuttle service they offered was a great resource to take us sightseeing and it was pretty available to us. Hotel was pretty quite the night we stayed and the rooms are very comfortable. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucygoosey1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, both times for business. Not sure if you would classify this as downtown Seattle but you're not.very far away. When you walk in, you immediately see the funky decorations. Very neat vibe in the hotel. Staff were friendly and check in didn't take very long at all. Rooms were nice, same funky retro vibe, but everything was very clean and polished. Room was fully decked out - wifi, working desk, good lighting, blowdryer, etc. The hotel has a coffee shop and restaurant on site, vending machines - so you have access to drinks, snacks, etc if you want them. As for whats around hotel, there is a walgreens across the street and gas station. Area is not bad to walk around in in the day, but i wouldnt at night. Just down the road, since this is close the university, theres a decent mall with shopping, a grocery store, starbucks, etc. About a 5 min drive, not walkable if you're in a hurry though. All in all, very nice place and i look forward to staying here again on my next trip to seattle :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, attractive, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Shannon M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend, and when our first room had no wifi access, they quickly moved us to another room (we're in the middle of job and house hunting so internet was crucial). The staff was extremely friendly and the location is fantastic. The one disappointment was the room service we splurged on one morning for breakfast- it was pretty pricey and decent but not great food. I'd recommend going to any of the half dozen great breakfast/brunch places within a 10 minute walk instead.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Collins, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Recommended, good rate, fine stay.”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: Had a fine stay at the Hotel Deca the weekend before Christmas 2011. A Fall Promo rate was the initial reason we considered staying. It would be worth checking into any sale they might be running. Our rate was about half the regular. The Deca is located near the University in a good area for walking and restaurants. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Clean hotel, art deco theme, lovely lobby. The rooms are old, but really nicely done. And as mentioned in another review, the walls are pretty thin. We had a couple of breakfasts at the hotel restaurant, The District Lounge. One was great, one was sent back. The restaurant itself is in desperate need of refinishing, but it was convenient. The service was very good, and the huge beveled windows gave us a great view for people watching while we ate. We happened to be chauffered this trip by our son, who was offered free in-and-out parking for the duration of our stay. We do recommend The Deca and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a funky pedestrian neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Patadeperr0
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and answered all our questions effectively with personal suggestions and good restaurant options. The room was clean, quiet (even though we were across from the elevator) and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: kdoOregon
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel was fine. It was clean. The people were nice. But you notice I only gave it three stars. I needed to provide a counterbalance for the other reviews that gave it five stars - which I definitely did not feel it deserved. We travel with an 11 year old and a 13 year old. We made reservations for 4 (two adults, two children). We arrived in the late afternoon (so not too late, but not too early). We had a junior suite reserved which has a king bed and a pull out couch. The gentleman at the desk asked us if we wanted to have the pull out made up or if we could do it ourselves. We are easy going and said we could handle it. We went to our room. Changed and went to a wedding. We got back at about 11:30 at night. We went into the closet and found one pillow and a comforter. No sheets. Opening the bed we found the most lumpy, disgusting mattress. It was just plain gross. I went down and asked for sheets and something to cover the mattress. They sent it up promptly. We were only there for one night, so we didn't notice until the end, but there was only one wash cloth, two hand towels, and two bath towels. A couple other things - they give you ear plugs - something I've never seen in a hotel room. They must have known that we would be able to hear our neighbors - even their snoring. My guess is the walls are thin, not that we had particularly loud neighbors. On the plus side, they gave us free parking (we changed our reservations, so we were paying the maximum - not their fault - so I thought it was nice that he gave us the parking for free). They promptly resolved our problem as much as they could, but nothing could make up for that horrible mattress. The people who worked there were very nice. Three stars might be a bit harsh, but if you are traveling with children, I wanted you to know about the completely sub-standard bed. Also, since we had reservations for four, it would have been nice if they had bedding, towels, and earplugs for four.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing everything, great location.”
Reviews.Author: thecure123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and it was great the whole time, first it is very convienent to plenty of foods options, bars and bus stop. Also the restaurant inside had great food. You must try the mac and cheese. The shower had great water pressure, shampoo/conditioner and body soap was awesome...oh and the view was breathtaking of downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: swhli
Reviews.Content: I really like our stay at this hotel. We stayed there last week for 2 days and it was rather enjoyable. This hotel has a well-lit parking lot ($12 a night extra), spacious and clean rooms. The safe is big enough for a 15" notebook computer to fit in nicely. The only thing that you have to watch out is the hot water: both the bathroom and the coffee machine. The hot water sprayer/sprout (not sure what it is called) on the Mr. Coffee machine can pop out easily right after you have brewed a cup of coffee and want to start another one right away. I almost got burnt because of the hot air from the sprout came out under pressure. Also, I strongly recommend that the hotel lower the bathroom hot water temp to save energy and possibly lives. It is very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Neptune Theatre”
Reviews.Author: Elly2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Deca in the University District because it was across the street from the theatre where I was going to see a band play. Turned out, the band was staying at the hotel too! My hotel experience was great--the lobby was large, with plenty of seating a a gas fireplace. The check-in process was very quick, and the staff was kind and accomodating. I was upgraded to a King Suite. My room was large, tastefully appointed and quite comfortable. There were nice touches like an iPod dock/stereo, flat screen TV, sitting areas and floor lamps. The bedding was top notch. The hotel was quiet, and I never had any problems with noise. The bathroom is small, but clean and serviceable. For the price I paid, this was a great value, and I would stay here again when staying in Seattle. I think they even offer a shuttle service to downtown Seattle, which is a great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a reasonable price - good value”
Reviews.Author: FENTON64
Reviews.Content: A very unique hotel booked based on reviews, price and location. I booked a single queen but was upgraded at no charge to a double queen - I was told the single queen was rather small. Room was very clean and bed was comfortable. Free internet and parking. Wide variety of locally owned restaurants within walking distance. Staff was very friendly and the hotel also offered a free shuttle. They had a restaurant onsite, but I did not try it.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: hlreds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel DECA during Thanksgiving, and the staff could not have been nicer. Anything we asked, they looked up for us. The room was a good size and decorated tastefully with Hopper art reproductions on the walls. It was clean, and the beds comfortable with down covers. It is not luxury, but a good comfortable place to stay. Without hesitation we would go back. The coffee shop downstairs was a big plus for early morning coffee. Lastly, it is also reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca Amazing”
Reviews.Author: glwfood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Deca while touring University of Washington. It is cozy, warm, gentle and the staff is amazing. My room had a beautiful view of the university, nice sheets, towels and bed. The staff helped me find my way around UW and Seattle. The restaurant was wonderful. My son and I both loved everything. The downstairs lobby has a fireplace and big warm cozy chairs. I am visiting again next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: zheb
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at hotel Deca. Very friendly staff and great service, upgraded our room at no additional charge when we asked to be moved away from the elevator. Very clean and nice ambiance with the recent renovations they have done. Amazing views of downtown Seattle and the mountains. Used the free shuttle a few times, really easy and convenient. And the internet is free, something I haven't encountered in a while in American hotels. The beds were great and comfortable. The location is great too, I would recommend it to Seattle visitors without a car. There are buses that run to most landmarks from the U district. The only thing I would suggest is to have exact change when using the metro bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SMills_12
Reviews.Content: We stay in Seattle quite a bit & this was our first time @ Hotel Deca. We made the reservation through AAA about 1 1/2 hours before arriving @ the hotel & they didn't have our reservation yet. They were able to accomodate us & even gave us a room upgrade since we had that problem @ check-in. The room was nice, the bed was really comfortable and we had a really nice view of Seattle including the space needle. We would recommend this hotel to anyone & will plan to stay on our return trips to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Megan1127
Reviews.Content: Best service by far. Colin at the front desk was amazing and made our nights stay very comfortable and special. Absolutely recommend hotel deca to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Pause Button”
Reviews.Author: CornerSitter
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic in their attention to detail: from a clean and maintenance free room to a peaceful pause from the hetic requirements of work during my business trip. The check-in and check-out was super smooth and the services provided were above the norm of other hotels I have stayed in during my 35 years of traveling. The staff reminded me of the wonderful customer service I have received at European Resorts. The entire hotel was clean and if it was not the staff were immediately on the scene to polish or clean-up the problem. Location was perfect sitting on the edge of the campus and to many wonderful restaurants. Please ask about the history of the hotel! Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel with Remodeled Rooms”
Reviews.Author: yosunC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip in September for the Intel AppUp Elements event. We asked for a quiet room and were placed in a corner room on the 6th floor, facing the parking lot and Brooklyn Ave NE. The hotel is like the Art Deco-ish version of the Ace Hotel, although without the idiosyncratic scribblings on the walls. Plus: Although this is an old hotel, the rooms have been recently remodeled in the memorable style of a boutique hotel that tries maintaining elements from its historic roots. The bed was wonderful - the mattress was just so perfectly soft and the bedding was luxurious for the price-point. The bathroom toilet, showerhead and sink were new, but were of a historic 1950s style. Quaint blue art-deco arm chair and odd long cylindrical art deco pillow on the bed. Tully's Coffee attached - wonderful coffee freeze's! The four green chairs seem iconic of the hotel - the same image was printed on the room key card! Free Wi-Fi (then again, this being so close to UW, that's not a big issue) Location - right across the street from a UW building, a short block away from the main UW campus. Also, convenient access to Seattle (free shuttle, when available), and a fifteen minute drive to Bellevue, Washington, across the bridge. The hotel staff, being mostly UW students, gave some good restaurant suggestions. Very interesting bottled water in the room, shaped like a classic art deco building. Was tempted to buy it just for the bottle! Minus: The corridors on the room floors were moldy and a bit dank, needing remodeling. The front desk was stingy about the courtesy shuttle, almost always denying its availability, but when we walked downstairs to the shuttle directly, we found that the shuttle was actually available! Corner room was a bit small, but was the only one available on the quieter side. We booked a 3 night stay, and it didn't come with any perks. We rented a car for just one of the days, but we had to ask for comp'd parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hip,fun,and stylish... the staff have a way of making your day!”
Reviews.Author: griftered
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca will not ever try to outshine its competition with fancy meeting rooms and swanky chairs around a roaring fire... Although, it could!!! The rooms are just stylish enough, all with a view. The adjacent coffee shop screams "Welcome to Seattle"... No, The Hotel Deca makes its mark with its staff. I could go over every small experience and relate to you the smile here or the helpful gesture there. I encountered those types of things at every turn. Two staff members went above and beyond making my trip and enjoyable one. Firstly, Colin,.... you are the man. Thanks again for the help setting up my week stay with you, your patience set the tone that my long week was going to be made most comfortable, once i made it home to Hotel Deca. Thanks again Colin. Once at Hotel Deca, walk downstairs to "The District" this place is very nice, food and drinks all very good and affordable. The staff all great, but special thanks to Robyn. Great bartender, let me talk her ear off. Without people like this its all just brick and mortar.... thanks guys. -e

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LivinHi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Deca for many days over a period of weeks. It was very comfortable and so conveniently located. There are lots of restaurants within a couple of blocks and a grocery store just down the street. Upon request you can have a frig and microwave in your room. I enjoyed the nice bathtub and the view of Mt. Rainier out the window. I will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy room!”
Reviews.Author: Juneever
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night but the room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY!!! THANK U HOTEL DECA!”
Reviews.Author: Carly v
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel Deca after a journey to Seattle from Miami, only to find out that our reservation had not been forwarded to the hotel from the wholesaler we had used. In spite of this, the receptionist Tanya, provided the most outstanding service I have ever received in a hotel and was quick to not only fix my situation and accomodate what I had orignally booked, but was able to upgrade me, and took the time to answer all of my questions about the hotel, and the surrounding areas of the city. Every single employee I encountered was friendly, accomodating and genuninely happy to be working. The food in both the restaurant and the in room dining service was excellent, and a complimetary shuttle was provided several times during the day betweent the hotel and downtown Seattle-excellent value for an excellent experience. Billy the shuttle driver was awesome-happy friendly, and super punctual. he even took the time to check my room for something I had left behind, and called to reassure me it was there and safe. I will absolutley return to the Hotel Deca everytime I visit Seattle, and as a travel agent, advise all of my clients this is the only, and best place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value.”
Reviews.Author: MJI3
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife have stayed on many occasions over the past several years. The hotel rooms have always been clean and we feel that they are quite cozy and spacious for the rate. Customer service has always been very hospitable and accommodating. On one occasion, while dinning at their restaurant, our server had sent up a complimentary bottle of wine after we had commented to her how we had enjoyed it. More recently, one of the hotel's front desk staff, Colin, had offered a complimentary bottle of champagne to apologize on behalf of the hotel for the inconvenience caused as a result of a tv remote not functioning due to dead batteries. We found this gesture to be unexpected and completely unnecessary, although much appreciated nonetheless. These two examples are just some of our notable experiences at the hotel and it has been these types of experiences which will ensure another return.

Reviews.Title: “terribly small bed and room for a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: jack s
Reviews.Content: Very small double bed, in a very small room. Bed slammed against the wall so could only get out over the end or over my wife. This room only suitable for a single person. Main room was 10 ft X 10ft, with a 4ftX4ft bath ( had to stand over toilet to close door). Didn't take advantage of the breakfast due to being upset with room. Remote had dead batteries. Have to say the room was clean and tidy, and the staff would have upgraded us if there had been room, but this room should have never been supplied to a couple. I would personnally rate this room as a 2 star. We usually stay downtown at the Westin which is much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but not for business”
Reviews.Author: acoustictrout
Reviews.Content: Great value, comfortable bed, spotlessly clean, super friendly staff, spectacular view, beautiful decor---everything top notch. Now the bad news for business travelers: The wi-fi is as slow as dial-up and less reliable. Highly recommended for anyone not needing internet but this one simple item rules out this hotel for anyone who needs to stay connected.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca stay was a delight”
Reviews.Author: pamela l
Reviews.Content: Our son, a student at UW, recommended Hotel Deca to us, as it is close to his rental house. He had never been inside it, but liked its location. We were delighted with the hotel. Hugh, the desk manager, upgraded our room when I expressed concern about the reviews that mentioned thin walls. We did not hear our neighbors at all when we stayed at the hotel this past weekend, for 3 nights. We had a stunning view of the lake, and Space Needle, Mount Rainier, and the Olympics. Even though the hotel was at capacity with the last football game at the stadium before its tear down, the hotel was welcoming, staff was friendly, elevators were always at the ready, parking was available just outside the door. Live jazz in the bar downstairs, good coffee in Tully's. All in all, it was a great stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was very impressed with how friendly the front desk was. They had orginally had me in a room with a full size bed but put me in a room with a king size bed at no charge which I thought to be very thoughtful. The room was very nice and had an awesome view of the cascade mountains. The bathroom was small and I thought the communal soap in the bathtub was a little tacky for a 3.5 star hotel. My issue with this hotel lied within the restaurant. It was horrible. We went for breakfast and they were out of bacon and biscuits. The menu was very limited and beingout of what they were out of...made the choices even smaller. The parking was 12.00 which I thought was VERY reasonable for the area. I would stay here again...would definitely avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Jack K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there while on a business trip. The hotel is located in a great area of Seattle right next to the university. It is a beautiful art deco hotel with a modern day twist. Though I didn't spend much time there, the time I did was amazing. I also have to thank Colin for looking out and taking care of us. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “an undiscovered gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: westcoasttraveller09
Reviews.Content: We booked the Deca because it was close to the University, where we were attending a Huskie game this weekend. It is a delightful gem! Parking was easy, the king bed was so comfortable and I loved the fact the window opened and we didn't have to use the A/C. Beautiful modern decor, great flat screen TV, overall very unique. The price was right & there was lots to see and do in the University district, easy access to the I5. Great value, definitely our hotel of choice when visiting Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were back in Seattle visiting family and attending the University of Washington homecoming game, and chose to spend our stay at Hotel Deca. We were helped by an employee named Colin, who was incredibly helpful in our lining up our after-dinner entertainment on Saturday. The room was clean and comfortable, and always turned down when we wanted it to be. The location is in easy walking distance from the UW campus, as well as a host of coffee shops, bars, and a host of other kinds of stores that would keep anyone entertained for days.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasent place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Larry E
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference on the campus of Washington University and was booked into the Hotel Deca. My room was clean and nicely appointed, and the Hotel had a very comfortable feel. Good customer service, Excellent food, and a coffee shop made me wish I had more time to spend there. Even if you are not going to the the campus, it is a great place to stay when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: I want to extend a sincere Thank you to all Associates at the Hotel Deca for making my stay such a memorable one.The personal care each associate put forth made me feel as though I were the only guest in the Hotel. The food was incredible, customer service impecable,accomodating, clean,great veiws and very central to get around in the City. I would highly recommend Hotel Deca and would consider it a 5 star establishment. Superior Customer Service and I will only stay there should I return to Seattle. Special thank you's to Tanya, Ben, Eddie, Tom,Alex, Ryan,Jimmy,Robin,Sean, Caitlin and Ian.Like I said it was that memorable I recall all those staff members names. Job well done you all need to be proud of your profession and know how very good you all are at your job! Michael McBurnie, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Eric W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting her mother in UW Med Center and needed a place close by to stay. The Hotel Deca was only a few blocks away and easy to get to and find parking. The Art Deco decor is wonderfully warm and inviting! Our room was expansive and well designed. We loved the location, as there is a LOT going on in that part of the U-district! The food at the hotel restaurant was excellent! I highly recommend this stay for anybody wishing to stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky decor, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for a friend's wedding and ended up booking at Hotel Deca based on the recommendation of my friend's new hubby. Good choice. The staff is super freindly and accommodating, and the place is located conveniently and has great views from the upper floors. The only issue was a bit of a mix up with the reservation, but I booked through a third party website so maybe it was their issue and anyway the deca staff made it right.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Better Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddess333
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for a wedding in May and decided to stay in the University district. Hotel Deca looked like a charming place on the web. We checked in and were tired after traveling across country, the staff was very helpful and upgraded our room to the 15th floor with a view. Woke up the next morning opened the drapes and saw the most amazing site, Mount Rainier with no cloud cover. An amazing site! The staff was very cheerful and helpful, even showed us the free video rentals. They had some GREAT restaurant suggestions. There was a fair on University over the weekend and we got so see some amazing local artisans and sample some fine cuisine. We will be staying at Hotel Deca next and every time we are in Seattle...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Jim Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best values in the U District, maybe the very best. I had an elegant suite with a great view for less than I would have paid almost anywhere else in the U District for an ordinary room. The suite did show traces of its older incarnations (older bathroom fixtures, etc) but they were just fine for me. The bedroom looked totally new and stylish. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Even better on the second time..”
Reviews.Author: BUZZAlison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Deca earlier this year from July 28th to August 1st. I had no problems with that stay, Room 307 worked out great for us. Since they did so well on the last visit, I re-booked the place for my trip to Seattle in October. I was rewarded with a room on the 15th floor (great view of the Seattle skyline), a cheaper rate, and free parking. The hotel staff was very nice and remembered us from the last visit. Almost all my stays in the Seattle area require that the hotel lodging is close to the Greenlake area and near the U-district. I don't have a need for staying in downtown. This was convenient for us. Our stay was originally for four nights, but family obligations stretched it to 6. We also saved some money by picking up some food items at the nearby Safeway, and using the fridge and microwave. The breakfast was fine downstairs, but seemed a little pricey. One of the best things was that the bed was extremely comfy, especially after a long drive. I've stayed at the University Inn and the Watertown in the same area. They're okay, but a bit more pricey and the staff seems more reserved. This place gave me a warm feeling. They did great, and I know I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with caring staff”
Reviews.Author: y_wonder
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice. The room could have been a little cleaner. The 2am staff showed they really cared for my every need. Young man was vey professional and polite. No name tag though so never got his name. Thankyou for the accomodations and making us know u cared about us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lastri
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviews make me wonder if they're about the same hotel. This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had, so this review will have a lot of superlatives. The decor throughout the hotel was stunning. My friend and I had a room with 2 (extremely comfy) queen beds - it was stylish, huge (with a walk-in double closet) and very quiet. The view of the Space Needle was fabulous. The room rate was great value. The staff couldn't have been more efficient or helpful. Great location (near Trader Joe's!) with a range of good, reasonably-priced restaurants nearby. Having a Tully's coffee shop off the lobby was another plus for me. The FREE shuttle service was amazing: no need to stay downtown - they'll take you there and bring you back. All you have to do is ask. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, artsy, and small”
Reviews.Author: Chola K
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cozy and made me feel like home. My room was very small - much too small for two people to comfortably relax in - so we didn't spend much time there. The beds were very, very comfy...even with two people crammed in!! The staff was was very friendly and even gave us a bottle of their private labeled wine (which was awful, vinegary wine), but the gesture is what counts! Location is close to the freeway, university, and a trader joes. I enjoyed my stay there but I wouldn't pay more than 120 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location by UW, but rather small rooms”
Reviews.Author: 123KK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Deca was a nice facility but the rooms were smaller than expected. The room prices had just recently increased due to a UW Huskies game, which was very inconvenient for us as we were on a limited budget. They did have a hospital rate which was an improvement, but still led us to cancel one night early (my husband was able to stay at hospital with me). We did enjoy the live jazz at the bar downstairs, which was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while touring UW for college daughter”
Reviews.Author: Dan F
Reviews.Content: This place was the top choice while doing a web search for a place to spend the night while in Seattle. My daughter plans on attending UW for her grad program, and we had a free weekend this summer to come up from Corvallis, OR (OSU) for a visit. Taking Amtrak and public transportation to check on over-all benefits of her staying in Seattle for a few years. This Hotel was right next to campus, on the city bus line to downtown, and had a shuttle if we needed it to make our train departure on-time. We were able to check in and dump our bags, grab a quick snack, and walk the edges of campus on a Saturday evening to get a feel for it's lifestyle. The next morning we had a nice breakfast and then a self-tour of campus and visited their museum. Plenty of time before the noon check-out, and time catch a bus headed downtown for our 220 pm train departure. Having such a nice hotel right where we needed one, with a quite atmosphere away from downtown, with a friendly staff and great places to eat and rest while checking out the area greatly enhanced our visit. The cleanliness and professionalism re-enforced my opinion that not staying in a chain motel further away from my destination was a wise decision. And the price was not that much of a difference when considering the hassle of transportation and time that would have been wasted choosing something further away.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable with character”
Reviews.Author: heathert390
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Deca was very pleasant. The front desk staff was welcoming and friendly. The rooms are small, charming and full of character. Overall, I would definitely stay at Hotel Deca again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deca is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth92352
Reviews.Content: The Deca is a really cool hotel. What makes it a cut above the rest is the outstanding personal service one receives from each and every staff member. We were last there in May and they actually remembered us! So cool!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and tacky hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: A plastic chest of drawers with a microwave on top is in the tiny closet. Closet had shower curtain-like "door." Bathroom had no shower curtain. It had a liner hung on cheap rings that weren't even clipped. Shower had giant shampoo, conditioner and lotion bottles where you pumped what you needed. No Internet in room despite 3 calls. Motel, er, Hotel must be run by students. Not worth the money. Shameful.

Reviews.Title: “The Dead Bunch of Roses in Vase at Front Desk Should Have Been 1st Clue”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Seattle, I was disappointed to realize that this hotel isn't in downtown but rather the college part of town (my fault - should have read the reviews more closely). Despite poor location, this hotel has done nothing to endear myself to this city. I am eagerly awaiting checkout time. This place is quite gross! The dead roses really should have been the signal to find accommodations elsewhere but I gave them the benefit of the doubt. Bad decision..... Getting off the freeway, the hotel looms tall, old and tired (it was probably nice in the 80's). The lobby, though very dark, gives one hope that the rooms will be equally as decent. Not even close. This is a rundown facility in need of major renovation. A flat screen TV does not make the place modern and upgraded. The carpets in the hallway and room are filthy. The room and bathroom are small. There was interesting patchwork done to the wallpaper in the bathroom. The bathroom ceiling and windowsill have lovely peeling paint. The towels are one step above threadbare. The smell is odd throughout. Quite musty. On the pro side: the bed is comfortable and sheets are soft. Just don't look too closely at the cloth headboard...anyone who is a bit of a clean freak and has a vivid imagination may lose some sleep wondering about what the stains are. If you have any electronic devices, good luck charging them. It takes an enormous talent and creativity. There are two outlets (lower than knee level) on either side of the room. They are so old that the chargers constantly fall out. Try the outlet in the bathroom - it is slightly better. One would think that there might be an outlet near the desk - not the case here. They boast free wifi. Service and reliability are spotty. You get what you pay for, right? Skip the "restaurant" in the basement if your frat/sorority days are well behind you. The food is awful and oddly attempting to be fancy in a place that looks like its your parent's old, musty basement. It falls quite short. The ensuing stomach pains throughout the night weren't fun. The staff is great. Super nice kids running the place - hotel and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place to stay near UW”
Reviews.Author: WeesieCrim
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Staff was friendly and it was conveniently located next to UW. I really appreciated the operable windows, which allowed me to have fresh air instead of AC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: 10truck
Reviews.Content: This place is north of seattle in the university district near university of Washington. The hotel, from the outside looks modern if this was 1971. The inside is nice and updated. So don't fear. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Not a bad place to stay. Plenty of free parking. The area seems a little dirty, but all of Seattle does. Like it needs a good scrubbing with the frequent washdowns of rain it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value & good service”
Reviews.Author: TimSWellington
Reviews.Content: The Deca is a mid-size, mid-range, non-chain hotel in the University District (about 5 miles north of the Seattle CBD) and offering good value and good service. The immediate locality is interesting, with a good mall 1 mile away and lots of cheap & cheerful restaurants nearby. The hotel offers a very useful free shuttle into the CBD, which makes up for any disadvantage with the location. Excellent service and efficiencies or economies such as a Tully's coffee shop next to the lobby. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for North Seattle Attractions”
Reviews.Author: sleepywonder
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we needed 2 queen beds (many boutique hotels cannot provide that since the rooms are small) and it is managed by the same company that owns the Edgewater (my favorite hotel). We also planned on visiting Woodland Park Zoo and Paseo so this location was perfect. The room was of average size, enough space for 2 beds, desk and chair. The bathroom was smaller than I expected (single sink) but overall everything was fine. The decor was nice throughout the hotel. There is a bar in the basement that is managed by another owner, but shares the space and has street access as well. The parking lot is adjacent to the hotel but is not owned by the hotel (parking is paid with your room) and the spots are very small. I have a Suburban so we were barely fitting in between the lines. I did not have any issues find an open spot in the lot (even on a busy August weekend in Seattle). The beds/pillows were very comfortable. Having Tulley's Coffee on the main floor is very beneficial as well. No pool at this location in case you're wondering. We ate breakfast out so I cannot tell youabout the food, although it's included in the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Attended wedding taking place at the University and bride chose this hotel for guests. Great choice! Rooms clean, staff accommodating and helpful. Shuttle available to campus which was extremely convenient. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnSunderlandUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days whilst in Seattle. Although not central it's not a problem the shuttle bus will drop you off and pick you up anywhere within reson and as long as not already booked. The hotel is ver well decorated and stylish. We had a corner room which was quite small but the normal rooms seem very large; avoid a corner room! We were thoroughly happy staying here the staff were great as was the hotel in general. The coffee shop was good too. Out only gripe was the cleaning staff forgot to leave any cups for our coffee maker so after a long drive we wanted to relax with coffee and couldn't room service didn't bring them in an hour after us ringing so we went to the cafe in the lobby. However, that was just a small point in an otherwise lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nexttripplanned
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel quite by accident and were absolutely thrilled. We have since stayed 3 times and I am just making my next reservation. No need to even think of another hotel when in Seattle. I hope they always have a room when I come down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always and will have many future returns”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is ideally situated for a college visit and close to downtown Seattle. Its' customer service is top notch. I would recommend it to anyone and I have already done so many times.

Reviews.Title: “Completely met my needs and will stay here on my next trip”
Reviews.Author: NETraveler3
Reviews.Content: The personal service of the staff was excellent; I was greeted by name all week as I came and went. It's an older property, excellently renovated and well maintained. I liked the security of using my room key to access my floor via the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when visiting Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: ShawntaMBush
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Deca in Seattle. We will always stay here when we travel to Seattle. It is close to several ethnic restaurants and the UW. We like that it is so close to downtown. The staff is always wonderful. We were upgraded to a beautiful city view room with no extra charge for both visits. You can walk to just about anything you need, gas, Trader Joe's restaurants, Apple Store, and a bike shop. The freeway access is only a few blocks away. Parking is extremely reasonable. The decor is fun and the views cannot be beat - it is a treat to wake up to the city skyline unobstructed......you will not find a better hotel or a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shana K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to stay in Seattle. We liked the reviews and the price so made the reservation. When we got there we asked about an upgrade. They were booked but we were offered a great deal on the presidental suite. It was amazing. Stunning view (downtown Seattle, Bellevue, Rainier) huge deck and very cool rooms. The staff was helpful and friendly. I can't imagine a better experience. The only hard part was leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: May W
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter to University of Washington for orientation. Great location. Five minute walk to the "W" entrance. Staff was very friendly. Hotel shuttle took us down to the shopping district and picked us up when we were ready for pick up. Overall, great experience. Would definitely recommend Hotel Deca.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near UW...!”
Reviews.Author: laurel a
Reviews.Content: It's a small boutique hotel, really, and the staff is very personable. Aside from a small glitch when I made the initial reservations (they made the reservation for July, not August, and didn't send a confirmation so I didn't realize it until I got a notice that I hadn't shown up for my stay and was going to be charged a fee for not canceling in advance), which they fixed, everything ran smoothly. Nice clean art deco-style rooms. Very close to Univ. of Washington, so a great place to stay if you are visiting the campus. A long wait for the elevator, but the second one was under repairs. Hopefully two will be running next time!! Good coffee shop (Tully's) on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “A two-star hotel at three-star prices”
Reviews.Author: awsamuel
Reviews.Content: If you *hate* staying at chain hotels and want something with character that is also clean...and care about character more than location, service, amenities, comfort, or value, then this is a good choice for you. If character is NOT the most important criterion for your hotel stay, then you will likely be disappointed. We are frequent visitors to Seattle and looked forward to staying at the Hotel Deca as an alternative to big chain hotels downtown, especially since we really like the University District. But the Deca feels like a hotel run by people who thought it would be super fun to decorate a hotel...but don't actually know anything about running one. The service is nice but ineffectual: it took eons to get us checked in (albeit to an upgraded room...which we would have appreciated if we hadn't run out of patience before we got to it), the bell man never brought up our bags, and there was no way to get a drink or food at 10:30 on a Friday night! While the rooms are cute in a let's-be-clever-about-decorating-on-a-tight-budget sort of way (I can just hear someone saying, "hey, we won't have to pay for closet doors if we hang nice fabric across the opening!") they are actually not well laid-out (one of our beds was right next to the door to the room, the other beside the door to the bathroom; the TV is really too far from the bed to view comfortably). The hotel is also in very poor repair. The vending machine beside our room was so loud that it woke our kids up...but since nobody answered at the front desk, we just unplugged it ourselves. We couldn't get the shower to run anything except scalding hot water, and we couldn't get the water to shut off after the shower. The air conditioning was broken in the fitness room so you couldn't really work out for more than a few minutes without risking heat stroke. All in all, a big disappointment, especially given the price...which was $30 more than we paid for the Westin the last time we were in Seattle, where we were much more comfortable, much more centrally located and had way better service.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Stay tomorrow for my birthday , fingers x'd !”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy-J1
Reviews.Content: Well after hearing good things about this hotel I have decided to book in for this weekend. I am Scottish but on a gap year in Canada and have been dying to stay in Seattle and tomorrow is my birthday so decided to treat myself and just spend some of my money go :) Have booked the Romance deal as i love the idea of the late 2pm checkout which a lot of hotels only offer at crazy prices ! I have just called and have spoken to Alex on reception to enquire about parking and check in times, who was very helpful and explained we can call ahead to enquire if our room is ready early, he was really polite and didn't seem to struggle with my accent ( which is a first haha ) all seems good so far, I'm excited and hope it makes my birthday ! Will update tomorrow when we get there and when I am another year older !

Reviews.Title: “Suited its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Deca for one night on a quick trip to Seattle. PROS - The staff was friendly and helpful. - Nice cozy little pub in the basement. - Comfortable sleep, nice clean bathrooms, overall the room was very good. - The decor is lovely. Modern, clean, very appealing. - Coffee shop just off the lobby CONS - Situated close to the University, the neighbourhood is sketchy. We went for a walk around and did not enjoy it, and I was somewhat afraid to walk on my own. But, we were going to a show at the theatre across the street, so for that, the location was perfect. And driving distance to downtown Seattle wasn't bad. - The bed was TINY. We slept comfortably but unless you can sleep in a double bed or smaller, go for a larger room with a larger bed. - The girl in the coffee shop tried to short change me for a few dollars. Not the hotels fault, but something to be aware if when visiting the coffee shop. BOTTOM LINE - very serviceable stay in Seattle. I wouldn't spend an extended Seattle vacation here, but it is a very good one night option.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and the staff was great”
Reviews.Author: sdc_11
Reviews.Content: Everything that we asked for we received and more. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. They went above and beyond. Gorgeous view. Must stay place.

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Deca!”
Reviews.Author: tadundon
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay in hotels in Seattle since it's home... but we stayed here for a wedding and loved it! Great hotel, very helpful with with wedding party craziness. And you can't beat the location in U-District.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at a great price (great price for expensive Seattle)”
Reviews.Author: SCruz517
Reviews.Content: History of hotel and decor make it intriguing; the cleanliness of everything, comfortable beds and room layout made it a good value; and the friendliness and efficiency of staff completed the picture to make it a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss This One - a great experience”
Reviews.Author: sparkle100
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation after we found the Hotel Deca on the Seattle Children's Hospital website. We had never been to Seattle, and coming for the first time for a hospital visit and clinical tests is always an emotional experience. We were pleased right away as we stepped into the lobby for checkin. Comfortable chairs and murals, soft music in the background, and pleasing coffee house attached to the lobby and a nice fireplace will await you. Our daughter was really tired after the airport and needed to sleep before checkin to the clinics and the room was spacious and had great room darkening shades. Quiet too. The staff are professional, competent and friendly. All amenities and well-kept and the entire experience was first-rate. Our family recommends the Hotel Deca highly and we hope to return to Seattle for a "fun" visit in addition to our Seattle Children's Hospital visits. Thanks very much. P.S. the delicious aroma coming from the restaurant was really enticing, but for the kind of hotel stay we needed, restaurant time was not on the agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised & Delighted”
Reviews.Author: trvsg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding night so we decided to go back for our two year anniversary. I had spoken with Wesley the two years before, and so I asked to speak with him again when making my reservation. When we arrived for checkin, Wesley was helping another guest so Hunter checked us in. Wes had made some notes apparently that it was our anniversary and we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite!!! When we went up to our room, we were absolutely blown away. Not only was it the nicest hotel suite I have ever seen, let alone stayed in, but they also sent up champagne and cupcakes for us. We spent the better part of 30 minutes just taking pictures of the room to brag to our friends later. So fun. All in all, it was an incredible surprise for us and we had a wonderful time. Thank you Hotel Deca and Wesley! We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodation close to the University of Washington”
Reviews.Author: PhiPsi32
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hotel Deca to attend a seminar at the University Law School. The law school building is a short walk from the hotel (about three blocks). The hotel is in an excellent location with good access to a variety of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are in excellent shape with appealing decor. Hotel Deca features an in room DVD player and has a library of DVDs available to guests. I cannot comment on the quality of the selection as I brought my own entertainment. The beds are comfortable with plenty of pillows. However, the pillows are extra soft and don't provide much support if you are trying to prop yourself up. The nightstand has a great clock radio with iPod and line out connectors to attach your MP3 player. The hotel offers free WiFi with a guest access code. The connection is adequate as far as broadband connections go. The signal was a little weak in my hotel room but very good in the hotel lobby and restaurant. The connection timed out frequently while online requiring me to input the access code over again. My biggest complaint is the in room lightning. The bed side lamps are very weak and don't provide very much light for reading. I spent most of my time in meetings, and so I can't comment on the hotel staff and other amenities as I did not have time to make use of them. Overall, it the accommodation was very good, and I would stay there again if I have business at the university.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AwesomeAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 1st to the 5th of July and really enjoyed Hotel Deca. The staff were very friendly and helpful, even when they were working on 4th July. The cafe (Tullys) attached to hotel is very convinient and the restaraunt also attached (The District) was alao very nice and reasonably priced. Alcohol was very cheap during happy hour. After initially declining a $15 per night room upgrade to a double queen suite, the guy at the desk bumped us up for free anyway. It's fairly easy to get around on the bus from one street over and there's mostly young college folk on board so it's a comfy ride. Finally, we left our camera behind in the room and only realised when we got to the Amtrak station. We called and the front desk was only too happy to collect it, wrap it in bubble wrap and send to our next stay in Vancouver, Canada. I'd recomend this place to anyone and the renovations to building look great.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gracie43
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in June at the Hotel Deca. This is the 6th or 7th time I have stayed there and have always had a fabulous experience. We prefer boutique hotels. Location is great. Proximity to the University is huge selling point. Even if you are not there for University purposes, do not miss a chance to walk around that spectacular campus!! The staff is unsurpassed--young, super friendly, always helpful. We have only used the shuttle a few times, but I think they will take you any where. Rooms have a European feel, and have HANDS DOWN the best linens and pillows of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The bar restaurant is one of the best kept secrets of the U District. Small but interesting menu, and again, super staff. Honestly, I do not have a single gripe about this hotel. Finally, do not miss the U District farmer's market. It is 2 blocks away from the hotel and is open only on Saturdays (I think), all year round. It puts Pikes to shame. Very authentic, not touristy and you can sample veggies, cheeses, meats, mushrooms, honeys, syrups, pastries, etc etc. Flowers are spectacular. Always music, tons of fun. Eat your breakfast there too!! I Sent from my iPad

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for sevice, keep looking”
Reviews.Author: JimVancouver
Reviews.Content: Planning a family trip with our grandkids, we tried booking a room on this hotel's web site only to have it crash on us. We called their reservation line and they made a new reservation for us, saying they would look into whether the web reservation had gone through and cancel it if it had so we weren't double booked.
